dcterms:creator: Pranav Rajpurkar
Jian Zhang
Konstantin Lopyrev
Percy Liang
dcterms:description: The Stanford Question Answering Dataset (SQuAD) comprises over 100,000 question–answer pairs written by crowdworkers. SQuAD 1.1 guarantees that the passages contain valid answers to the questions posed.
dcterms:title: SQuAD 1.1

dcterms:creator: Pranav Rajpurkar
Robin Jia
Percy Liang
dcterms:description: SQuAD 2.0 increases the task’s difficulty by including another 50,000 unanswerable questions, and models are expected to identify when a passage does not contain an answer for the given question.
dcterms:title: SQuAD 2.0

dcterms:creator: Rico Sennrich
Barry Haddow
Alexandra Birch
dcterms:description: The WMT’14 English-French test set (newstest2014) contains 3,003 sentence pairs, used for evaluating and generating adversarial examples in neural machine translation.
dcterms:title: newstest2014
